subject: p10402372
Findings: Review of frontal and lateral views were remarkable for bilateral lower lung bronchiectasis with peribronchial opacities. In the right lower and medial lung, peribronchial opacities have improved since. There are no new opacities. Lungs are mildly hyperinflated. Heart size, mediastinal and hilar contours are normal. No pleural effusion.
Impression: Bilateral lower lobe bronchiectasis with improved right lower medial lung peribronchial consolidation.
